definition.name: "Configure AWS Credentials" Action for GitHub Actions
definition.description: Configures AWS credentials for use in subsequent steps in a GitHub Action workflow
definition.author: aws-actions

inputs.name: aws-region
inputs.description: AWS Region, e.g. us-east-2

inputs.name: role-to-assume
inputs.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume. Use the provided credentials to assume an IAM role and configure the Actions environment with the assumed role credentials rather than with the provided credentials.

inputs.name: aws-access-key-id
inputs.description: AWS Access Key ID. Provide this key if you want to assume a role using access keys rather than a web identity token.

inputs.name: aws-secret-access-key
inputs.description: AWS Secret Access Key. Required if aws-access-key-id is provided.

inputs.name: aws-session-token
inputs.description: AWS Session Token.

inputs.name: web-identity-token-file
inputs.description: Use the web identity token file from the provided file system path in order to assume an IAM role using a web identity, e.g. from within an Amazon EKS worker node.

inputs.name: role-chaining
inputs.description: Use existing credentials from the environment to assume a new role, rather than providing credentials as input.

inputs.name: audience
inputs.description: The audience to use for the OIDC provider

inputs.name: http-proxy
inputs.description: Proxy to use for the AWS SDK agent

inputs.name: no-proxy
inputs.description: Hosts to skip for the proxy configuration

inputs.name: mask-aws-account-id
inputs.description: Whether to mask the AWS account ID for these credentials as a secret value. By default the account ID will not be masked

inputs.name: role-duration-seconds
inputs.description: Role duration in seconds. Default is one hour.

inputs.name: role-external-id
inputs.description: The external ID of the role to assume.

inputs.name: role-session-name
inputs.description: Role session name (default: GitHubActions)

inputs.name: role-skip-session-tagging
inputs.description: Skip session tagging during role assumption

inputs.name: inline-session-policy
inputs.description: Define an inline session policy to use when assuming a role

inputs.name: managed-session-policies
inputs.description: Define a list of managed session policies to use when assuming a role

inputs.name: output-credentials
inputs.description: Whether to set credentials as step output

inputs.name: output-env-credentials
inputs.description: Whether to export credentials as environment variables. If you set this to false, you probably want to use output-credentials.

inputs.name: unset-current-credentials
inputs.description: Whether to unset the existing credentials in your runner. May be useful if you run this action multiple times in the same job

inputs.name: disable-retry
inputs.description: Whether to disable the retry and backoff mechanism when the assume role call fails. By default the retry mechanism is enabled

inputs.name: retry-max-attempts
inputs.description: The maximum number of attempts it will attempt to retry the assume role call. By default it will retry 12 times

inputs.name: special-characters-workaround
inputs.description: Some environments do not support special characters in AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY. This option will retry fetching credentials until the secret access key does not contain special characters. This option overrides disable-retry and retry-max-attempts. This option is disabled by default

inputs.name: use-existing-credentials
inputs.description: When enabled, this option will check if there are already valid credentials in the environment. If there are, new credentials will not be fetched. If there are not, the action will run as normal.

inputs.name: allowed-account-ids
inputs.description: An option comma-delimited list of expected AWS account IDs. The action will fail if we receive credentials for the wrong account.

inputs.name: force-skip-oidc
inputs.description: When enabled, this option will skip using GitHub OIDC provider even if the id-token permission is set. This is sometimes useful when using IAM instance credentials.

inputs.name: action-timeout-s
inputs.description: A global timeout in seconds for the action. When the timeout is reached, the action immediately exits. The default is to run without a timeout.

outputs.name: aws-account-id
outputs.description: The AWS account ID for the provided credentials

outputs.name: aws-access-key-id
outputs.description: The AWS access key ID for the provided credentials

outputs.name: aws-secret-access-key
outputs.description: The AWS secret access key for the provided credentials

outputs.name: aws-session-token
outputs.description: The AWS session token for the provided credentials

outputs.name: aws-expiration
outputs.description: The expiration time for the provided credentials
